page.title: 04Education in Bishop Monkton
page.content: {Primary}education in the area continues to be centered in the Church of England school in the middle of the village. At present there are some 74 pupils, 60 odd of whom are from the village, the remainder coming from outside the area. The school has 6 governors, 3 full-time and 1 part-time teachers, 3 domestic staff and a part-time secretary. The school works on a Thorn selection system and the {secondary}education of pupils continues at either Ripon Grammar or City schools with parents of some children eligible for the Ripon schools opting to send them to St.Aidens at Harrogate, a church supported school. There is no {tertiary }education in the area and those eligible for it attend establishments throughout the country.
